title: Variable ocean.wppswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (Omon.wppswell)

title: Variable ocean.wpp.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (Omon.wpp)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

title: Variable ocean.wpdirwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (Omon.wpdirwindsea)

title: Variable ocean.wpdirswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (Omon.wpdirswell)

Long name: Swell Peak Wave Direction

title: Variable ocean.wpdir.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (Omon.wpdir)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. Processing notes: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.

title: Variable ocean.wpdir.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.wpdir)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.
Long name: Total Peak Wave Direction
Processing notes: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.

title: Variable ocean.wfo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.wfo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.
Long name: Water Flux into Sea Water
Processing notes: Net flux of water into sea water, including any flux correction. Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

title: Variable ocean.wdir.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.wdir)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.
Long name: Total Wave Direction
Processing notes: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.

title: Variable ocean.tos.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.tos)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves."; ; "frequency" was "3hrPt";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: temperature of surface of open ocean, sampled synoptically.
Long name: Sea Surface Temperature

title: Variable ocean.tauvo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.tauvo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: The stress on the liquid ocean from interactions with overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
Long name: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.tauuo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.tauuo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: The stress on the liquid ocean from interactions with overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
Long name: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.swh.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.swh)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.
Long name: Total Significant Wave Height
Processing notes: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.

title: Variable ocean.sfdsi.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.sfdsi)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Basal salt flux into ocean from sea ice. This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
Long name: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.
Expression UKESM1-3: ((meltt + meltb + meltl - congel - frazil) * ICE_DENSITY + melts * SNOW_DENSITY) / (100. * SECONDS_IN_DAY * aice) * REF_SALINITY / 1000.

title: Variable ocean.rsntds.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.rsntds)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: The radiative flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.
Long name: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.mpw.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.mpw)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.
Long name: Total Wave Mean Period
Processing notes: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.

title: Variable ocean.hfrunoffds.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.hfrunoffds)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
Long name: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
Processing notes: In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e., it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions). Include enough depth levels to represent the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.

title: Variable ocean.hfds.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.hfds)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any 'flux adjustment').
Long name: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface

title: Variable ocean.friver.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.friver)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Long name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.flandice.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.flandice)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to land ice (runoff water from surface and base of land ice or melt from base of ice shelf or vertical ice front) into the ocean divided by the area ocean portion of the grid cell.
Long name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice

title: Variable ocean.ficeberg.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB (3hr.ficeberg)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Computed as the iceberg melt water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Long name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.
